intro: Rubia peregrina var. balearica, commonly known as the Balearic balm, is a perennial herb native to the Balearic Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but typically not consumed by humans. It thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is valued for its medicinal and aromatic properties. Its presence is an indicator of well-preserved, undisturbed habitats.
